full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### Project Manager, Junior

The Department of National Defence (DND) is pleased to announce a proposed procurement for a Junior Project Manager to support the Director General Aerospace Equipment Program Management (DGAEPM) / Director Aerospace Equipment Program Management (Fighters and Trainers) to work with the North Warning System (NWS).

### Job Description

*Job title: Junior Project Manager*
*Tier 1 (< $3.75M)*

The successful bidder will be responsible for managing a project with an estimated level of effort of 240 days per year, with an estimated contract duration of 3 years, plus 2 irrevocable option years.

### Contract Details

* Contract type: Service contract
* Security requirements: Common PS SRCL #41, FSC - Secret
* Region: National Capital Region
* Location: 455 Boulevard de la Carrière, Gatineau, QC
* Contact information:
	+ File number: W8485-TSPS2024-14
	+ DND point of contact: Khan Check (khan.check2@forces.gc.ca)
	+ Phone: (819) 939-5741

### Eligibility

This requirement is open only to pre-qualified suppliers under the Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) Supply Arrangement. The list of pre-qualified suppliers is available on the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website.

### Scope of Work

The successful bidder will provide project management services for a project with the following scope:

* Project management services for a project with a duration of 3 years, plus 2 irrevocable option years
* Estimated level of effort of 240 days per year
* Support for the Director General Aerospace Equipment Program Management (DGAEPM) / Director Aerospace Equipment Program Management (Fighters and Trainers) to work with the North Warning System (NWS)
* Management of the project from start to finish, including project planning, scheduling, budgeting, risk management, and quality control.

### Evaluation Criteria

The procurement will be conducted in accordance with the Evaluation Criteria outlined in the Request for Proposal (RFP) documents.

### RFP Documents

The RFP documents will be e-mailed directly to the qualified supply arrangement holders who are being invited to bid on this requirement. Bidders are advised that RFP documents are not available on the Government Electronic Tendering System (GETS).

### Closing Date

The tender closing date is January 19, 2024 at
